com.topcoder.util.config
Interface PluggableConfigSource

public interface PluggableConfigSource

A pluggable source of configuration data. An implementations of this interface should have a public non-argument constructor and should support their configuration with Properties.

Since:
Configuration Manager 2.1
Version:
1.0 05/07/2003
Author:
isv, WishingBone

Method Summary
 void configure(java.util.Properties props)
          Configure this source with initial parameters from given Properties .
 java.util.List getProperties()
          Gets the list of properties contained within this source of configuration data.
 void save(Property root)
          Saves properties and their values starting from given "root"-property to underlying persistent storage.
 

Method Detail

configure

public void configure(java.util.Properties props)
               throws ConfigParserException
Configure this source with initial parameters from given Properties . This method is immediately invoked by PluggableConfigProperties after instantiating the PluggableConfigSource object.

Parameters:
props - a Properties containing parameters to configure this source
Throws:
ConfigParserException - if any exception related to underlying data source occurs
java.lang.NullPointerException - if given props is null

save

public void save(Property root)
          throws java.io.IOException
Saves properties and their values starting from given "root"-property to underlying persistent storage. After completing this operation this source of configuration properties should contain only properties from properties "tree" specified by given roor.

Parameters:
root - a "root"-property that is an entry-point to whole properties hierarchy tree
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if any exception disabling successfull saving of properties data occurs

getProperties

public java.util.List getProperties()
                             throws ConfigParserException
Gets the list of properties contained within this source of configuration data.

Returns:
a List of properties
Throws:
ConfigParserException - if any exception related to underlying data source occurs
